page.title: 03LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area consists of gently rising land from a minimum height of{13m}in the south east to a maximum of 52m.in the east. An area of low-lying land(between{13m. and{23m}) is occupied by{Defford {airfield.}This is bounded to the west by a north-south ridge of moderate slopes, maximum height{32-33m.}The highest land is in the eastern and northern third of the region. More moderate slopes are found above{30m. culminating in a northern plateau at {43m.}in the area of{Lady Wood}and two knolls at{52m.}in the east and{39m.}in the south east. The latter area forms the site of{Defford village}above the flood plain of the{Avon}to the south. Surface drainage is not extensive but two streams drain southwards while {Croome River}in the far west has been made into a 1.5km. long estate lake.
